comments.author: Obari
comments.created_time: July 26, 2023, 03:09:55 PMLast edit: July 26, 2023, 08:36:10 PM by Obari
comments.body: Quote from: sam2014 on July 26, 2023, 02:17:17 PMBumpWhat's the Â essence of bumping a thread that is newly created today?No need to rush and I will advice that you take things very easy on yourself and if you stay active on the forum, Â the right clients for you will definitely come knocking at your door without any hassle.Wishing you best of lucks

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: This is a good move you know. At first rendering such services free of charge would project your capabilities to the platform. This is a good form of self marketing and as such should be properly utilised to achieving success.I checked and I noticed you have been here for quite a long time with much activities but however, you would still need to do more work growing up. So I would ask you this question, how do you intend having a conversation with your prospective clients when we all know that this platform is a pseudo anonymous platform. Do you Â plan holding a live video session with your client if they insist. Lastly, I see this is a new post and the rate at which you keep bumping is not normal. Allow for 24hours before bumping. If you wantÂ  to remain relevant keep on with your posts and engagement here and clients will come your way.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: These three bumps in the span of 24 hours are not good to look at, this is breaking one of the forum rules it may get your account in trouble if you continue doing this, instead of bumping your thread leave a free analysis within the span of 24 hours so people will have an idea on how good you are, you did not have a website or a Youtube channel or a telegram channel to give us a sample on your technical analysis skill all you have is a telegram contact and an Instagram that shows nothing of your skill.

comments.author: longyenthanh
comments.body: You can only "bump" once every 24 hours. I advise you to delete recent posts and stick to the rule of one day, because unfortunately, but this behavior can end in a few days ban at best.That is my free consultation session for you

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: longyenthanh on July 27, 2023, 04:45:49 PMYou can only "bump" once every 24 hours. I advise you to delete recent posts and stick to the rule of one day, because unfortunately, but this behavior can end in a few days ban at best.That is my free consultation session for youÂ  So we have a bot here who wants to give us a free one-on-one session on your investment portfolio, if this is the kind of character that you want to get knowledge on how to handle your investment just forget, he is mindless of the advice of other membersÂ  I don't know what kind of advice he can give because it's not showing the way he behaves, this is not an expert behavior but a childish behavior who ignore others suggestion.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: The fact that the guy is so impatient and keeps bumping his thread disregarding the forum rules tells me that it would likely be a good idea to avoid his services. At the very least I would look for an escrow before I sent this user any money.
